North Korea offered to drop its nuclear and missile programs in exchange for security guarantees and economic aid

ldc_scope.charseq: North Korea offered to drop its nuclear and missile programs in exchange for security guarantees and economic aid, according to U.S. officials

extent.charseq: North Korea's military may have fired a laser at a U.S. helicopter in March

ldc_scope.charseq: North Korea's military may have fired a laser at a U.S. helicopter in March, a U.S. official said Tuesday, as the communist state ditched its last legal obligation to keep itself free of nuclear weapons
No one was injured and no equipment was damaged in the incident

extent.charseq: North Korea is believed to have exported US$580 million worth of missiles to Iran, Pakistan, Libya, Syria, Egypt, Yemen and the United Arab Emirates in 2001

ldc_scope.charseq: A U.S. military official in Seoul, speaking on condition of anonymity, said Tuesday North Korea is believed to have exported US$580 million worth of missiles to Iran, Pakistan, Libya, Syria, Egypt, Yemen and the United Arab Emirates in 2001

extent.charseq: December, a shipment of North Korean missiles bound for Yemen

ldc_scope.charseq: In December, a shipment of North Korean missiles bound for Yemen was briefly stopped in the Arabian Sea

ldc_scope.charseq: North Korea accuses the United States of planning to attack the communist country, which Bush has branded part of an ``axis of evil'' along with Iran and Iraq
